column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Write a Baby Card
#Text=Imagine that you have been invited to a friend or coworker 's baby shower .
#Text=Along with a nice toy you purchased as a gift , you 'll need a card .
#Text=Now , what to write in it ?
#Text=Steps
#Text=Finding a Card
#Text=Pay attention to the baby shower invitation ; Does it say if the child is a boy or a girl ?
#Text=If so , it is sort of ' traditional ' to get a gender themed card , such as a blue one with pictures of toy trucks for a boy or a pink one with glittery decals for a girl .
#Text=However , it is up to you how genderfluid you would like to be .
#Text=Browse the card aisle of the Dollar Store and find something you like !
#Text=Beginning to Write the Message Inside the Card
#Text=Begin with a pen or sharp pencil .

#Text=Adress the parents/mother ( there are multiple ways of doing this , such as ' Dear Mr. and Mrs. Last Name , ' ' Dear Soon to Be Parents , ' ' Dear Mother on the Way , ' ' Dear Excited Almost-Father ' ) .
#Text=First Paragraph
#Text=After adressing the recipient(s) , skip down a line and indent .
#Text=Begin the paragraph by writing something along the lines of ' I ca n't believe you 're going to be a parent ! ' ( such as ' Aaaah ! I 'm so excited for you to have your child !
#Text=' or ' It 's so hard to believe you 're pregnant ! ' ) .
#Text=Staying in the first paragraph , back up this excited first sentence with a memory that you share with this person/these people .
#Text=It can be as simple as the time the wife complimented your shirt or as deep as the first time you sat next to the dad on the bus in second grade .
#Text=After that , jot down something along the lines of '
#Text=You/The two of you are such amazing people .
#Text=You will be awesome parents .
#Text='
#Text=Customize this last sentence a bit .
#Text=Second Paragraph
#Text=Once again , skip down the paper a little and indent .
#Text=Begin with a quote or Bible verse about parenting/birth .
#Text=For example , the first sentence of this paragraph could be ' " Fathers , do not embitter your children , or they will become discouraged .
#Text=It 's true .
#Text=My children Reena and Jaelyn are the reason I do everything from smiling to breathing .
#Text=They are the lights of my life , just as your child will be for you ! I do hope you enjoy the gift .
#Text=It 's so exciting to shop for this new arrival ! I 'm always willing to babysit or watch the baby whenever you need me to .
#Text=Love , Erika Alabaster
